item.title: Reuters reveals U.S. SEC suspended internal watchdog for 7 days after misconduct finding
item.dc:creator: Jaime-Lee Charles
item.description:
Reuters exclusively reported that the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) suspended its inspector general Carl Hoecker for seven days without pay […]

The post Reuters reveals U.S. SEC suspended internal watchdog for 7 days after misconduct finding appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively reported that the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) suspended its inspector general Carl Hoecker for seven days without pay in 2020, despite an independent government committee recommending that the agency consider firing him for “serious misconduct.” The SEC documents provide new details on how the agency responded after a government investigation, first reported by Reuters in December, concluded that Hoecker abused his authority by conducting a “remarkably biased and flawed” internal probe into allegations against two of his employees.

The post Reuters reveals U.S. SEC suspended internal watchdog for 7 days after misconduct finding appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals U.S. diabetes deaths top 100,000 for second straight year
item.dc:creator: Jaime-Lee Charles
item.description:
Reuters exclusively reported that more than 100,000 Americans died from diabetes in 2021, marking the second consecutive year for that grim milestone […]

The post Reuters reveals U.S. diabetes deaths top 100,000 for second straight year appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively reported that more than 100,000 Americans died from diabetes in 2021, marking the second consecutive year for that grim milestone and spurring a call for a federal mobilization similar to the fight against HIV/AIDS. The new figures come as an expert panel urges Congress to overhaul diabetes care and prevention, including recommendations to move beyond a reliance on medical interventions alone. A report released earlier this month calls for far broader policy changes to stem the diabetes epidemic, such as promoting consumption of healthier foods, ensuring paid maternal leave from the workplace, levying taxes on sugary drinks and expanding access to affordable housing, among other areas.

The post Reuters reveals U.S. diabetes deaths top 100,000 for second straight year appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters exclusively reveals Chesapeake Energy nears $2.4 bln deal to buy Chief Oil & Gas

The post Reuters exclusively reveals Chesapeake Energy nears $2.4 bln deal to buy Chief Oil & Gas appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Chesapeake Energy Corp shares dropped as much 3.4% after Reuters exclusively reported that the company is in talks to acquire privately owned natural gas producer Chief Oil & Gas for around $2.4 billion, including debt. The acquisition by Chesapeake, a U.S. shale gas and oil producer that only emerged from bankruptcy just last year, underscores the recovery of parts of the energy industry as natural resource prices surge to multi-year highs.

The post Reuters reveals Acacia Research contacts Kohl’s to explore bid for retailer appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Kohl’s Corp shares rose as much as 8.8% after Reuters broke the news that the U.S. retailer has been approached by a potential buyer. Acacia Research, which is backed by activist investment firm Starboard Value, has held talks with Kohl’s in the last few days to lay the groundwork for a bid, people familiar with the matter said.

The post Reuters reveals U.S. talks to energy firms on EU gas supply in case of Russia-Ukraine conflict appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters reported exclusively that the U.S. government has held talks with several international energy companies on contingency plans for supplying natural gas to Europe if conflict between Russia and Ukraine disrupts Russian supplies. Citing U.S. officials and industry sources, the report noted that the discussions were led by senior advisor for energy security Amos Hochstein.

item.title: Reuters exclusively reveals Biden weighing cuts to 2022 ethanol blending mandate proposal
item.dc:creator: Jaime-Lee Charles
item.description:
Reuters exclusively reported that the Biden administration is considering lowering the 2022 ethanol blending mandate amid backlash from the oil refining lobby […]

The post Reuters exclusively reveals Biden weighing cuts to 2022 ethanol blending mandate proposal appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively reported that the Biden administration is considering lowering the 2022 ethanol blending mandate amid backlash from the oil refining lobby and unions arguing the shrinking U.S. ethanol industry can no longer support the target. President Biden is finding it hard to live up to his vow to bring some normalcy back to the sector after his predecessor, Donald Trump, took unprecedented steps to relieve refiners from the requirement. 

The post Reuters exclusively reveals Biden weighing cuts to 2022 ethanol blending mandate proposal appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

The post Reuters exclusively reveals Exxon Mobil launches sale of U.S. shale gas properties appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively reported that Exxon Mobil has launched the sale of shale gas properties stretching across 27,000 acres in the Appalachian basin of Ohio, part of an ongoing divestiture of U.S. assets. A sale by the top U.S. oil producer could value the assets at around $200 million, based on current natural gas prices and existing production from the wells, a source said.

item.title: Reuters exclusively reveals Schlumberger adjusts operations planning as U.S. COVID-19 cases soar
item.dc:creator: Jaime-Lee Charles

Reuters reported exclusively that Schlumberger, the world’s largest oilfield services company, is adjusting operations planning as COVID-19 infections have soared among its […]

The post Reuters exclusively reveals Schlumberger adjusts operations planning as U.S. COVID-19 cases soar appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters reported exclusively that Schlumberger, the world’s largest oilfield services company, is adjusting operations planning as COVID-19 infections have soared among its U.S. workforce. Schlumberger has had around 14 employees per day test positive for the virus this month, compared to roughly two per day in November, according to an internal document. It has declined to say the percentage of workers who are vaccinated.

item.title: Reuters exclusively reveals U.S. health agency may be unprepared to take over COVID vaccine program
item.dc:creator: Jaime-Lee Charles
item.description:
Reuters exclusively reported that the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) appeared unprepared to assume full responsibility for the nation’s […]

The post Reuters exclusively reveals U.S. health agency may be unprepared to take over COVID vaccine program appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively reported that the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) appeared unprepared to assume full responsibility for the nation’s COVID-19 vaccine program, including activities currently managed by the Pentagon. The report cites a failure to ensure HHS has enough staff or a clear timeline for taking over those additional responsibilities. Additionally, the report found HHS had not ensured “it has sufficient workforce capacity” nor arranged “a schedule to manage the remaining vaccine development, manufacturing and distribution activities,” risking a loss of capabilities. 

The post Reuters exclusively reveals U.S. health agency may be unprepared to take over COVID vaccine program appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters exclusively reveals Walmart halves paid leave for COVID-positive workers
item.dc:creator: Jaime-Lee Charles
item.description:
Reuters reported exclusively that Walmart Inc will now provide up to one week of paid time-off if a worker contracts COVID-19, instead […]

The post Reuters exclusively reveals Walmart halves paid leave for COVID-positive workers appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters reported exclusively that Walmart Inc will now provide up to one week of paid time-off if a worker contracts COVID-19, instead of its earlier policy for up to two weeks. Walmart, the largest private employer in the United States with 1.6 million workers, is among the first major retailers to reduce paid leave for COVID-19 and could serve as a bellwether for other major employers. 

The post Reuters exclusively reveals Walmart halves paid leave for COVID-positive workers appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
